dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3572 IH: To make projects in certain counties eligible for funding under the rural surface transportation grant program, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Valadao (for himself, Mr. Fong, Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick, and Mr. Costa) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To make projects in certain counties eligible for funding under the rural surface transportation grant program, and for other purposes.

section.text: Section 173 of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a) by adding at the end the following:

The term covered county means a county that has an annual gross agricultural production value of at least $1,000,000,000 and agricultural production of at least $500,000 per square mile, for all crops and livestock sold, adjusted annually for inflation in accordance with the Consumer Price Index published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the Department of Labor.
The term farm-to-market road means a road located within a covered county.
in subsection (i) by striking subsection (k)(1) and inserting paragraphs (1) and (4) of subsection (k);

subparagraph.text: by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall reserve 10 percent of the amounts made available for the program for each fiscal year to provide grants for eligible projects located on farm-to-market roads in any amount.

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (5) (as so redesignated) by striking or (3) and inserting (3), or (4); and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Agriculture, shall create, and annually update, a list of covered counties.
